page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: {TRANENT}- Until recently most of the housing in Tranent was provided by the council.They consisted mainly of terraced villa-type houses and flatted villas.During the war there were two 'Pre-fab'schemes and now some of these are permanent homes through extensive renovation.Two private housing schemes have attracted people to the town - one at Carlaverock and one at Bankpark.The waiting time on the council list is about three years. The housing stock in 1985 - 223 2apt,1130 3apt,641 4apt,46 5apt Changes in legislation allows tenants to buy houses.152 former tenants are now home owners.There are no plans at the moment for further building of council houses because of the present budget restrictions and cut-backs,but a co-ownership scheme may be developed in 1987.
